title: LOL RIOT'S TROLLING ME GUYS WTF IS THIS
body:
LOL, So basically I sent in Riot a support ticket after this one game because the enemy Skarner had his ult up way too often so I think it was bugged or he was hacking, like he legit used it two times in a single fight that lasted like 15 seconds. Even my teammates were complaining like " yo wtf, how does he have his ult up so fast", he only had 20% cdr.
ANYWAY, when I asked the Skarner if he was hacking, he told me to kill my self, to die in a hole, etc. Basically got very mad for no reason, I was just trying to put some closure on the issue. 
I sent Riot a support ticket about this, with screenshots of his toxicity and how the Skarner had  his ult up every 10 seconds.

This is what they responded with : 

Greetings Summoner,

Unfortunately, this content is not currently eligible for our Refund Token system. I apologize for any inconvenience this causes you, and hope you understand that there is a limit to what we are able to refund. This feature was developed to give Summoners a chance to exchange content they regretted buying, but we had to limit the number of refunds we could reasonably grant.

For more information about our Refund Policy, feel free to read the following article on our Support Site:

https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201751864

If you have any additional questions or feedback please do not hesitate to let me know.

SwainRen 
Player Support Specialist
Swag Tactician of Noxus
----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Yeah, to be honest with you, this is all sorts of fucked up.  I went ahead and investigated what happened and I have some additional insight I can provide:

When our agents answer tickets, many of them have multiple tabs open at the same time.  This way they can very quickly move from one response to the other.  This kind of method isn't without risks as if you accidentally click back to the wrong tab to send a response, you can get a completely random response to your issue, which is what happened here (hence why you got a response about refund tokens).  We train our agents to make sure simple mistakes like this don't happen, but sometimes we royally screw up.  The agent was told about the issue and we're going to make sure this doesn't happen again.

That being said, there are two other points I want to touch on:

* ***Automated Responses*** -- We do have some automated responses, but they are extremely limited in scope.  The opening line in the automated response clarifies immediately that it is an automated response, and if you would like a human response, you can simply reply back to the ticket.  Otherwise, all of our tickets are handled by a real-life human, which is why these kinds of mistakes do happen.
* ***Copy/paste Responses*** -- There is no way to sugar coat this, so I'll just tell it to you straight:  We do use macros in many of our responses.  There are two main reasons why we do this:
 * On average, we get thousands of new tickets every single day (in NA alone), not counting the tickets that take multiple responses back and forth that get added on to this.  Our goal is to make sure you get a full resolution within 24 hours of you submitting a ticket, and to hit this mark, our agents need to respond quickly.  These macros are reviewed constantly to make sure that they resolve the vast majority of issues that you all have, and if it doesn't, we re-write it.
 * When answering tickets, we tend to see the same type of issue or question over and over again.  Even if we customized every single response, an agent tends to get very efficient at explaining what the issue is and how to solve it.  Over time, the variance between every response gets less as less as we tend to figure out what works and doesn't work and soon you end up with pre-written responses.  We can absolutely make a push to ensure every response is unique, but then we encounter a trade-off:  More customized response or faster response time?  We have surveyed thousands of players about this, and faster response time wins out almost every single time.

A lot of information to throw at everyone, but I want to be as transparent as I can.  If you have any follow-up questions, reply back and I'll do my best to answer them!

Here's a little bit of perspective: similar to Deep Terror Nami (but on a far lesser scale), I browse around the Boards and respond to people that seem to need help. I type out everything  independently, no copy-paste, but it's mighty tempting sometimes. It's just a hobby/time-sink for me, not a job; nobody is anxiously waiting, unable to play the game, until I can get a response to them.

Now Riot Support actually has a responsibility to the players. The faster they can respond, the more problems they can solve, and more players will be satisfied. Hundreds of tickets per day, per person (at a guess); copy-and-paste is a necessary tool to ensure that they are able to keep up a reasonable pace while still providing sufficient detail to fix the issue. But they're still human; there will be mistakes. Every so often somebody is going to click the wrong ticket, copy the wrong response, send a message to the wrong player, and things will get messed up. But by and large they do a fantastic job plowing through the never-ending ocean of complaints and questions.
